Reviews.Title: “Location and the stuff fantastic but not the hotel itself”
Reviews.Author: montanasinger
Reviews.Content: the location is Deira downtown; it is great. You have right there the train station Baniyas Square, walking distance to the gold market or gold souq and over all close to anything. the stuff is wonderfull; they are so nice and kind and always ready to help you out with any questions or concerns you might have; they make you feel at home for sure. Thanks to all of you guys, you are wonderful. as per the hotel I have to say is old building over all is not in a good shape, little water coming through the shower and some rooms can be smelly. But the worse is the noise. On the second or third floor is the african disco that makes shake the whole building and not one can sleep till the disco closes at 3am. More over at night as a man is very hard to get to the hotel as per the street in fromt to the hotel is packed with prostitutes that literary grab you and offer, where like or not, their services.

Reviews.Title: “a pure night life place”
Reviews.Author: vivekkmehta
Reviews.Content: You can find everything at this place. Located in a business place in bur dubai, this one is fully crowded with multiculteral happenings and attracts variety of people. I may not recommand this place for a serious business and family tourists but for sure a good place for a colourful lifestyle people.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: trentmeister69
Reviews.Content: Stayed back in Feb 2003. I think it was 5 star but probably one of the weaker 5 star ones in Dubai. Food was so-so and the rooms were spacious so i'll give it that. The best part about this hotel was that there was a porter working here who looked EXACTLY LIKE BORAT. I actually watched the Ali G show so I knew who borat was even back in 2003. He even had the same mannerisms as him/moustache/accent the works. As soon as I saw him I cracked up and couldn't stop laughing. WISH I got a picture with him now. Dubai had good sane dune tours in the buggys plus there is this very nice waterpark which was one of the best I have been to.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel with 2 Star standards”
Reviews.Author: ralhan_sandeep
Reviews.Content: quality of room service very poor, Gym & health center timings illogical, quality of staff average, no 4Star standards maintained. food served cold. for every poor service staff gines unreasonable excuses.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel in prominent location”
Reviews.Author: Johnsonsahayaraj
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife in this hotel, the room was so noisy of the loudness of Dance floors. The room was smelly and no service motto of the persons there. The food was one of the worst kind . It may be a good hotel for pickup joint and not to with a spouse.

Reviews.Title: “Desert safari”
Reviews.Author: yezadm
Reviews.Content: A very convenient location in deira.....situated next to lot of malls and food joints.....deira city centre is only a 10 mins walk......ok breakfast n rooms....descent service........

Reviews.Title: “Challenging Staff - Good club.”
Reviews.Author: BBABZ
Reviews.Content: Typical older 2 star hotel in the heart of Deira - part of the old city of Dubai. Pretty basic. Seemed to have a good choice of Indian/Pakistani/Bengali restaurants but they are basically clubs. Some nice reception and floor staff but waiters and porters didn't have a clue. No internet facilities. Rooms were clean Main problem I had was the porters in the reception area had absolutely no manners and were continually and rudely challanging guests to identify themselves in the evening. I am all for good security but good manners cost nothing. Excellent club - really good band - Cameroonian or Congolese. Will definately visit the club aagin but not the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: SA-BackPacker
Reviews.Content: Ramee International has the most disorganized and chaotic booking "system" of any hotel I've ever been to. They lost our reservation (even though we'd faxed a credit card number to secure it) and every person we spoke to about extending our stay told us something different. In the end we moved out and found another place. The hotel itself is OK and it is well located just off Baniyas Square, but the nightclub on the 1'st floor is very loud and breakfast is mediocre. They seem to cater largely to tour groups from Russia - menus and signs were printed in English, Arabic and Cyrillic.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jillewald
Reviews.Content: The was probably the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. I was just passing through Dubai for the night and wanted a cheap place to stay. The room was so dirty, from stains all over the carpet to the comforter looking like it came off of a homeless man. The bathroom smelled like a men's restroom at a dirty truck stop. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worst enemy!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel In Dubai?”
Reviews.Author: dogzcock
Reviews.Content: Cockroaches, I kid you not. There is a Bollywood night club on the 1st floor which booms until 3am 7 days a week, I was on the 5th floor and just can't imagine what it must have been like staying above the club on the 2nd floor. The place is known by locals as 'The Cave'. There is another club on the ground floor which also pumps out the volume until 3am. The bed linen was clean and the towels were changed every day but that's where the positives end. The whole place reeks of cigarette smoke throughout. The 2 rooms next to me were occupied by fellow Brits (4 30 something idiots)who obviously thought they were in Benidorm and shouted their heads off until 4am. It's a shame that I have to give this place even a token 1 star. The photos are about 25+ years out of date. I am informed that the rest of the Ramee chain is generally in the same condition. Shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you are travelling with a car!”
Reviews.Author: smsafiri
Reviews.Content: A very difficult place to find. The map provided by hotels.com was completely wrong. There is no parking available here and almost impossible to find parking anywhere nearby. This is a very busy and over-crowded part of Dubai. I would not stay in this area again. By some miracle, a parking spot was found about 4 blocks away. However, a month later my credit card got charged with a $200 parking fine that nobody could explain the reason for! The rooms in this hotel are okay. I was on one of the upper floors so the noise from the nightclubs did not reach me. I visited 2 of the nightclubs, but felt a little out of place as the only non-Indian on the premises. For a nice holiday in Dubai, it is better to choose one of the hotels elsewhere, in the new part of town.

Reviews.Title: “NASTY NASTY!”
Reviews.Author: nzinitaly
Reviews.Content: This place was difficult to find by our cab driver it is in a not so pleasant area of Diera. The front desk staff reception needed an attitude change and was not very friendly, it reeked of smoke odour, very very dirty and there is a niteclub which the bass literally vibrates the entire place. The sour receptionist gave us a room many floors away from the niteclub. At first the dimmed lights made the rooms ok untill further inspections. The sheets were stained and not changed at all (no crisp iron lines). The bathroom was scummy and the shower leaked onto the floor making it slippery. The toilet didnt flush and it took 2 attempts from the maintenance man to fix it. You need to take earplug as the noise from the niteclub and the tooting traffic will drive you insane. THIS HOTEL NEEDS SERIOUS DISINFECTING and new staff, to give it a score of 1 is a compliment!!!! If my five year old daughter was not so tired I would of gladly tried to find another hotel (I guess thats what I get for not doing my homework on TA). Yes it is very cheap & very very Nasty!! There are cleaner hotels in the area for much less , but they are not online as I discovered later from a Canadian businessman.

Reviews.Title: “only one star hotel instead of official 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: Inconvenient_Truth
Reviews.Content: I was staying one night in Ramee International. Minuses: - wall-to-wall was moldy at the entry to bathroom (see image) - bass originating from live music on ground floor penetrated inside my skull till 3am although I used ear plugs - Although they said in the reception that we were going to Jumeirah Beach Park by free bus ride, the driver bussed us to Al Mamzar Park - the room stinked of tobacco although it was a non-smoking room - cats were mewing on inner court once in a while Plusses: + air conditioning worked well and was installed to the ceiling so that it did not breathe straight to my face + I was able to see American Idols from telly

Reviews.Title: “Want to sleep or party?”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuy0123
Reviews.Content: If you want to party, this place might be fun with its several loud night clubs, which I did not visit. If you want to sleep, go elsewhere. Also, do not count on their advertised airport shuttle. I got no response to my request for a shuttle from the airport to the hotel, and the driver was not there for my scheduled trip from the hotel to the airport. The room was not very clean either.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for Dubai/ clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Seyselles
Reviews.Content: We booked Ramee with Ratestogo.com; and it came very cheap for Dubai, around 50 euros by room by night. From the airport with a taxi, it cost around 60 dirhams if I remember (13 euros), 20 minutes drive. The rooms are very large and clean, the bathroom has a fair size and quite luxurious. The only problems are a smelly entrance hotel hall because of a pizzeria there, and the prior of a mosque which wakes us up in the very early morning (then you go back to sleep): you are in the Emirates, don't forget! It is really worth it, because of the price, the location (in the center, easy to catch a taxi, a supermarket and a pharmacy just near) and the cleanliness. We will come back there. If you want better, you'll find hotels at double price, at least. We were with 3 children, so we got 2 rooms, but if you go there with 2 kids, they told us that one room is OK (the room have a sofa bed). We took the studio with the washing machine, but never used it. It looked new. We ate outside, more fun. But the breakfast in the room, less smelly... easy to buy the groceries down the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated and clean, but.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lovely big room, (we didn't have the upgrade with a washing machine, with kitchen, fridge, microwave etc. Opposite a mosque with loud speaker, so noisy when calling people to prayer. Breakfast rather basic & crowded small dining area meant we had to share table with others. Staff at reception not very helpful. The cleaner was superb. Heated pool on roof, clean and delightful to use. Website says free transport from & to Airport, but had not been arranged and staff not very keen to provide. Ended up getting a taxi which they said they would pay for, but then refused when we got to hotel. Mostly used by non-Europeans. Would not recommend for 1st timers to Dubai, but suited our purpose as we had family living there. Was only *** compared to most other hotels in areas which were *****, so was therefore a lot cheaper.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramee International Hotel Dubai
HotelInfo.Address: near Omar Al Kattab Rd, Nasser Square, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
